name: Black
Eyed
Peas,
Keane
and
more
to
join
Robbie
Williams
for
British
Summer
Time
show
content:
It will be the singer's first time performing at BSTThe names of the support acts for Robbie Williams‘ British Summer Time headline show have been revealed.It was confirmed last year that the pop star would headline one of the annual Hyde Park summer concerts, marking his first time performing at the festival.Black Eyed Peas and Keane will support the former Take That singer at the show, which takes place on July 14, 2019.Other names that feature on the bill are Texas and Feeder with “more acts to be announced.”Set to grace the Great Oak Stage, Robbie Williams is “one of the truly great British entertainers,” according to James King, Senior Vice President of AEG Presents.“We’re so excited to finally welcome Robbie Williams to Hyde Park who’s been on our wish list since we started seven years ago,” he said. “Robbie works a crowd like no one else and his collection of hits will be the perfect way to round off Barclaycard presents British Summer Time for 2019.”Also confirmed as headliners for the British Summer Time series are Barbra Streisand, Florence + the Machine and the National, Celine Dion, Bob Dylan and Neil Young.Tickets for all shows are on sale now.The British Summer Time show dates are as follows:July 20195 – London, Hyde Park (Celine Dion)
7 – London, Hyde Park (Barbra Streisand)
12 – London, Hyde Park (Neil Young / Bob Dylan)
13 – London, Hyde Park (Florence + the Machine / The National)
14 – London, Hyde Park (Robbie Williams)Last week, Robbie Williams reignited his feud with Liam Gallagher, calling upon his fans to tweet abuse at him during a show at his Las Vegas residency.“If you have enjoyed the show, I have been Robbie Williams,” he said at the end of the show. “And if you haven’t and you are upset about anything, I have been Liam Gallagher.”He continued: “In fact, if you want to start a hashtag, you can put ‘Liam Gallagher was shit tonight’ if you want.”
